etymology.description: semantic: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 皮(皮) (pí, "surface") = water surface -> wave
etymology.interpretation: The character 波(bō, "wave") combines the water radical 氵 to indicate relation to water, with 皮 serving as the phonetic component, hinting at fluidity or a surface feature like a wave.

examples.chinese: 海风轻拂时(海風輕拂時)，水面泛起微波(水面泛起微波)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎi fēng qīng fú shí, shuǐ miàn fàn qǐ wēi bō.
examples.english: When the sea breeze caresses, ripples appear on the water's surface.

examples.chinese: 小船在湖中荡漾着波(小船在湖中蕩漾著波)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo chuán zài hú zhōng dàng yàng zhe bō.
examples.english: The small boat drifts on the lake with gentle waves.
